intro: Eumachia rostrata, commonly known as the rostrated eumachia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical and subtropical regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in horticulture.
